metadata.feature_description: Configure whether content requires approval before publication for Answers, Discussions, Ideas, and Social Events modules.

test_scenarios.scenario_name: Enable content moderation for Answers module

steps.action: Navigate to Community Settings panel and observe initial state
steps.expected: Community Settings panel opens with Content Moderation section visible
steps.actual: Community Settings panel opened successfully showing Content Moderation checkboxes with Answers unchecked, Discussions/Ideas/Social Events checked

steps.action: Click on Answers checkbox to enable content moderation

test_scenarios.scenario_name: Disable content moderation for Discussions module

steps.action: Click on Discussions checkbox to disable content moderation

test_scenarios.scenario_name: Disable content moderation for Ideas module

steps.action: Click on Ideas checkbox to disable content moderation

test_scenarios.scenario_name: Disable content moderation for Social Events module

steps.action: Click on Social Events checkbox to disable content moderation
steps.actual: Social Events checkbox was successfully unchecked

test_scenarios.scenario_name: Enable content moderation for Discussions module

steps.action: Click on Discussions checkbox to enable content moderation

test_scenarios.scenario_name: Enable content moderation for Ideas module

steps.action: Click on Ideas checkbox to enable content moderation

test_scenarios.scenario_name: Enable content moderation for Social Events module

steps.action: Click on Social Events checkbox to enable content moderation
steps.actual: Social Events checkbox was successfully checked

test_scenarios.scenario_name: Save all moderation settings and verify persistence

steps.action: Click Save button to save all content moderation settings
steps.expected: Settings are saved with success message
steps.actual: Settings saved successfully with 'Item successfully saved.' message displayed

steps.action: Refresh the page and navigate back to Community Settings
steps.expected: All saved settings persist after page refresh
steps.actual: All four Content Moderation checkboxes (Answers, Discussions, Ideas, Social Events) remain checked after page refresh, confirming persistence

observations: The initial state showed Answers unchecked while Discussions, Ideas, and Social Events were checked - this differs from the suggested default of 'all true' for new installations, but may be due to prior testing on this instance

The Content Moderation settings are part of the 'Miscellaneous Community Settings' section which also includes Comment Moderation, Enable WYSIWYG, Page Size, Comments Page Size, Profanity Filtering, and Group Home Page settings
All checkbox interactions responded immediately with visual feedback
The Save button successfully persisted all settings to the database as confirmed by page refresh test
